title: Introducing: Sun Drums
content: I first came across Liverpool-based three piece Sun Drums back in summer 2009, at the Jailhouse in Hereford. They weren’t called Sun Drums then, they were called Bagheera, but on first listens of the Sun Drums EP, released on October 1st via Everybody’s Stalking, it appears that their general musical outlook has remained much the same. Which is definitely a good thing, because Bagheera were rad, and as it turns out, so are Sun Drums. Fans of the likes of Burial and Caribou will certainly find something to love among the EP’s five tracks, which do a fine job of melding William Bevan’s ghostly two-step with the more blissful, organic sounds that Dan Snaith is famous for, all served up with a distant, soulful falsetto and the occasional six-string. Expect a full review of Sun Drums closer to its release date, but in the meantime, you can stream and preorder the EP via the Everybody’s Stalking bandcamp, or listen to opening track Leaves Along The Stream here.
